text: Dalry Thistle Football Club are a Scottish football club, based in the town of Dalry, Ayrshire. Formed in 1920, they play at Merksworth Park. Currently playing in the , they wear dark blue strips. 2020 is their Centenary year. The team are managed since March 2013 by former player Gavin Friels.https://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/ayrshire/dalry-thistle-boss-gavin- friels-18817103 ==Notable players== *Jim Leighton - 91 international caps for Scotland, second only to Kenny Dalglish. European Cup Winners' Cup winner with Aberdeen. Also played for Manchester United, Dundee and Hibernian. *Hugh Baird - Airdrie, Leeds United, Aberdeen and Scotland *Ian Ure - Dundee, Arsenal, Manchester United and Scotland. *Pat Liney - Scottish Football League winner with Dundee in 1961–62 *Tommy Murray - Scottish Cup winner with Falkirk in 1957. *Tom Brown - Scottish Cup winner with Kilmarnock in 1997 and Scotland B cap. ==Honours== *Ayrshire Third Division winners: 2001–02 *Ayrshire (Ardrossan & Saltcoats Herald) Cup: 1960–61 *Ayrshire League (Kerr & Smith) Cup: 1933–34 *Ayrshire District (Irvine Times) Cup: 1939–40 *Ayrshire District League Champions: 2008–09, 2017–18 ==References== ==External links== *Club website Category:Football clubs in Scotland Category:Scottish Junior Football Association clubs Category:Sport in North Ayrshire Category:Association football clubs established in 1920 Category:1920 establishments in Scotland Category:Dalry, North Ayrshire Category:West of Scotland Football League teams
title: Dalry Thistle F.C.
